full_summary:
### Tender Notice
#### Title
Stage 1: Demolition of Residential Structures at Field - Yoho National Park

This is a competitive bid for the demolition of residential structures at two locations within the Yoho National Park. The selected contractor will be responsible for hazardous materials abatement, demolition of structural elements and foundations, waste removal and disposal, and site rehabilitation.

#### Tender Details
- **Reference Number**: CB-8991-21375411
- **Tender Closing Date**: September 28, 2023, 4:00 PM Eastern Time
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: October 16, 2023
- **Expected Contract End Date**: November 30, 2023
- **Estimated Contract Value**: Between $100,001 and $250,000 (excluding taxes)

#### Procurement Procedure
This is a two-stage selection process.

**Stage 1**: Evaluation of Bidders' Qualifications
In this stage, all interested contractors will submit their qualifications. A shortlist of qualified contractors will be established at the end of this stage.

**Stage 2**: Financial Bid Evaluation
The shortlisted contractors will be invited to submit a financial bid based on the specifications and drawings provided. The contract will be awarded to the contractor with the lowest bid price.

#### Special Instructions
- Bids must be submitted by fax or email. Bids received in person or by courier will not be accepted.
- The only acceptable email address for bids is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
- The only acceptable facsimile for bid submission is 1-855-983-1808.
- Bids must not exceed 15 megabytes in size. Large bids may be submitted in multiple emails.
- Emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted. Bid documents must be attached to the email.

#### Enquiries
All enquiries should be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority at least five business days prior to the tender closing date.

#### Contact Information
For further information, please contact:

Jen Maheu, Contracting Authority
Email: jennifer.maheu@pc.gc.ca
Phone: (587) 432-8458

#### Important Notes
- Documents may be submitted in either English or French.
- All work must be performed in accordance with the National Park Act and its regulations.

The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

CLOSED re: This opportunity is closed and no longer accepting bids. If you are interested in tendering
